# This is a program that uses recursion to generate the Fibonacci sequence
proc fibonacci {num} {
    # Base case
    # The first two numbers in the sequence are always 0 and 1
    if {$num == 0 || $num == 1} {
        return $num
    }
    # Recursive case
    # The Fibonacci sequence is generated by adding the two previous numbers
    set num1 [fibonacci [expr $num - 1]]
    set num2 [fibonacci [expr $num - 2]]
    # Return the sum of the two previous numbers
    return [expr $num1 + $num2]
}

set n 10
puts "The first 10 numbers in the Fibonacci sequence are:"
# Loop through the first 10 numbers in the sequence
for {set i 0} {$i < $n} {incr i} {
    set result [fibonacci $i]
    puts $result
}
